The [Dodging]() skill determines how well your character can avoid blows, beams and missiles fired by monsters.

## Useful Info

Dodging skill provides a bonus to [EV](/EV "EV"), equal to:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

```
(8 + 0.8 × Dodging × Dex) / (20 - size)
```

Size is a factor dependent on your species' [body size](/Size "Size"). [Humans](/Human "Human") are 0, [Spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") are +4, and [Trolls](/Troll "Troll") are -2. (See [Evasion](/Evasion "Evasion") for a full list.)

This bonus is then reduced by encumbrance, if any.

### Encumbrance

[Armour encumbrance](/Armour_encumbrance "Armour encumbrance") will directly lower the bonus from Dodging. This factor is not reduced by [Armour skill](/Armour_skill "Armour skill"), but it is reduced by [strength](/Strength "Strength").

- **If (encumbrance - 3) ≥ strength:**

* Modifier = `0.5 * Str / (encumbrance - 3)`

- **If (encumbrance - 3) < strength:**

* Modifier = `1 - ((encumbrance - 3) / (2 * Str))`

In either case, the modifier is multiplied directly with Dodging bonus, to get the final EV bonus.

If you are [paralysed](/Paralyse "Paralyse"), your Dodging skill is completely ineffective. The only thing that contributes to EV in this case is your size.

## Strategy

The [usual skill advice](/Early_Game_Character_Building "Early Game Character Building") in *Crawl* is to "train your killing skills to competency first, then train your defenses". Dodging an extra attack won't help if you have to use a consumable to beat every other fight. It's perfectly reasonable to turn Dodging off at the start, then turn it back on later on when you feel skilled enough at killing stuff.

Dodging is more effective when you have higher [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") and you are wearing lighter armour. Still, even a brute in [crystal plate armour](/Crystal_plate_armour "Crystal plate armour") will eventually want to train a few levels of Dodging, since the early levels of a skill are cheap.

## See also

- [Evasion](/Evasion "Evasion")

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), there was a stepdown on dexterity: if dex >= 24, `adj_dex = 14 + 10 * log2(1 + (dex - 14)/10)`. This reduced the impact of dexterity at high DEX values. Also, there was a separate stepdown if EV >= 30, documented in [Evasion](/Evasion#History "Evasion").
- Prior to [0.6](/0.6 "0.6"), characters could only train Dodging when wearing [light armour](/Light_armour "Light armour") and would train [Armour](/Armour_\(skill\) "Armour (skill)") only when wearing [heavy armour](/Heavy_armour "Heavy armour").
